oai_dc:dc.dc:title: THE EFFECT OF SEDIMENT COMPOSITION ON CROSS-SHORE BED PROFILES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: van Rijn, Leo C.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: sediment composition
bed profile
cross-shore profile
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper provides information on the effect of sediment (sand) composition on cross-shore sand transport and cross-shore bed profile evolution, based on computational results of a mathematical cross-shore profile model (CROSMOR) and data from flume and field experiments (Egmond beach, The Netherlands and Duck beach, USA). The model has also been applied to study longshore sand transport along a sand-gravel beach. Finally, the effect of sediment size on shoreface nourishment is discussed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 26 (1998): Proceedings of 26th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Copenhagen, Denmark, 1998.
